Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/5720/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

Test failure is a Jenkins environment issue:
```
Total time: 1 hrs 27 mins 13.543 secs
[FINDBUGS] Collecting findbugs analysis files...
Setting GRADLE_3_4_RC_2_HOME=/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/tools/hudson.plugins.gradle.GradleInstallation/Gradle_3.4-rc-2
ERROR: Step ?Publish FindBugs analysis results? aborted due to exception: 
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
Caused: java.io.IOException: Remote call on ubuntu-2 failed
	at hudson.remoting.Channel.call(Channel.java:838)
	at hudson.FilePath.act(FilePath.java:985)
Caused: java.io.IOException: remote file operation failed: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12 at hudson.remoting.Channel@4cfb1c65:ubuntu-2
	at hudson.FilePath.act(FilePath.java:992)
	at hudson.FilePath.act(FilePath.java:974)
```
retest this please

@guozhangwang sort of. As a general rule, we should not have code that is not called anywhere. At least a simple unit test would be good.

@ijuma This patch does not expose the errors I saw in the release candidate for 0.11.0.0 (it needs a rebase though). However, I personally have not been able to run all tests on Windows with this patch. The core tests always hang after a few hundreds of them run (with a few randomly failing).
Retest this please

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/5744/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

Testing the fix could be tricky. We have some logic for verifying heartbeat completion in AbstractCoordinatorTest. It might be possible to set a very large retry backoff and then verify that there is only a small delay seeing the heartbeat completion after a call to `pollHeartbeat`.

> Just a quick question. Does the patch actually tighten up any of the validation or is it just a better implementation of the existing logic? From a quick look at the code, it seems to me the patch is the latter?

The validation is exactly the same, but we refrain from allocating a buffer until the api key and api version have been verified.

Sounds good to me. What do you think @ijuma?
Retest this please.
Sounds good.
retest this please

> Doesn't look great to have a hardcoded parameter. However we're going to fully replace this class anyways, so LGTM for now.

Agree. I just picked the default value of `POLL_MS_CONFIG` -- as most people run with this and nobody complained it seems to work fine. This hardcoded fix will only remain in 0.10.2.2, in case we release it, as we won't uses `AdminClient` there.
Merging to trunk.
